docs.snippet: Sri Lanka has refused a visa request for a U.S. State Department official, the U.S. Embassy said on Tuesday after Washington signaled it would propose a U.N. resolution against the South Asian state over alleged war crimes....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sri Lanka has refused a visa request for a U.S. State Department official, the U.S. Embassy said on Tuesday after Washington signaled it would propose a U.N. resolution against the South Asian state over alleged war crimes.

headline.main: US: Sri Lanka Refuses Visa for State Dept Official After War Crime Accusations
headline.print_headline: US: Sri Lanka Refuses Visa for State Dept Official After War Crime Accusations

docs.snippet: A major fraud ring that staged fires and floods at South Florida homes to collect millions of dollars in claims from insurance companies has been broken up with charges against 22 people, authorities said Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A major fraud ring that staged fires and floods at South Florida homes to collect millions of dollars in claims from insurance companies has been broken up with charges against 22 people, authorities said Tuesday.

headline.main: Officials: 22 Charged in Fla. Insurance Fraud Ring
headline.print_headline: Officials: 22 Charged in Fla. Insurance Fraud Ring

docs.snippet: One of the cardinal rules in the Catholic church: obedience to the pope. So it has come as a shock for many in the Catholic world that John Paul II's most trusted confidant has betrayed the beloved pontiff's last will and testament by publishing p...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the cardinal rules in the Catholic church: obedience to the pope. So it has come as a shock for many in the Catholic world that John Paul II's most trusted confidant has betrayed the beloved pontiff's last will and testament by publishing personal notes he wanted burned.

headline.main: Hero or Traitor? Pope's Aide in Polish Controversy
headline.print_headline: Hero or Traitor? Pope's Aide in Polish Controversy

docs.snippet: A nationwide push by prosecutors and police to re-examine possible wrongful convictions contributed to a record number of exonerations in 2013, according to a report released Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A nationwide push by prosecutors and police to re-examine possible wrongful convictions contributed to a record number of exonerations in 2013, according to a report released Tuesday.

headline.main: Prosecutors Help Set Record Number of Exonerations
headline.print_headline: Prosecutors Help Set Record Number of Exonerations

docs.snippet: A doctor told Nido Jose Apil that his nephew, Nido Tania, the 18-year-old man who died after a fight with two shopkeepers, also had swelling of the brain....
docs.abstract: A doctor told Nido Jose Apil that his nephew, Nido Tania, the 18-year-old man who died after a fight with two shopkeepers, also had swelling of the brain.

headline.main: Initial Autopsy Shows Arunachal Pradesh Student Had Head Injuries, Uncle Says
